Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: Carmela R
Reviews.Content: From the rich, theatrical interiors, to the swank bar, and knock out grotto-like pool, the hotel makes Paris even more magical. The staff were always extremely helpful, as was the bar tender, recommending drinks after a long day soaking up priceless paintings at the Louvre. Not to mention an almost ideal location tucked away on a quiet Left Bank street, 10 minute walk from the Louvre, Notre Dame, The Latin Quarter, and surrounded by art galleries. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: J0el_K
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little boutique place in a quiet street on the left bank. The location is brilliant walking distance from the River and in a gorgeous area. You are surrounded by nice cafes, galleries, restaurants and if it's too laid back for you busier streets are not too far away. We loved it, our room was small but perfectly formed with a walk in wardrobe and view of the street. We used the steam room and pool in the basement (a must), dined at the restaurant which is fantastic and visited the bar which is equally charming. L'Hotel has a great history which is also part of the appeal. The main benefit of a small hotel is the lack of guests, breakfast was often taken with just the two of us in the dining room and this definitely added to the experience. I can imagine once you've found this place you'll always want to go back! I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel perfect neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelCriticIntl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at L'Hotel for 20 years and am addicted to the Left Bank neighborhood! The hotel itself is beyond charming, though we all know that the rooms are really small. It can be amusing and fun though. Everything you want is nearby, including the Seine. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristaLynnCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few nights here during our honeymoon in November 2011. This is definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in--the staff was courteous, the food and cocktails were fantastic, the decor is rich and full of character, and our room was luxurious and comfortable, even with the small size you have to expect for a European room. The best part is the candelit stone hamman you can book in the basement for a private dip and steam...so romantic! The only downside is that L'hotel has now set the bar for my future hotel experiences so high that I doubt we'll be able to match it. Would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic restaurant!!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaMac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris in October 2011 for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and wanted someplace quiet and romantic. We were recommended the restaurant (L'Restaurant) in L'Hotel and it couldn't have been more perfect! From the intimate bar for a pre-dinner cocktail to the quiet elegance of the restaurant we were pampered beyond belief. We chose to have the Chef's 5 course menu with wines and every dish was a work of art. My favorite was the frog's legs over spinach risotto-I could have had that as a main! The service was exceptional with the waiters very attentive without seeming to hover. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would love to be able to stay here next time we are in Paris. Tres Magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury personified”
Reviews.Author: NikNak586
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the luxurious L’Hotel Paris for a special weekend getaway, and I can say everything from customer service, room standard, Michelin restaurant experience and overall comfort levels greatly exceeded expectations – a truly first class experience! Will definitely be retuning next time we’re in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: thirtyfivebirds
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic three nights in this lovely place. Very pleasant staff, gorgeous room, lovely restaurant, delicous breakfast. Location is excellent. Very different kind of an hotel, really unique.

Reviews.Title: “Specialty Hotel, Well located, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: kma1984
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my 3 days at L'Hotel. Lots of character, friendly staff and the private pool and hammam are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Tomtom008
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel absolutely perfect for a weekend in Paris. Great service, cosy and clean room with nice details. Very convenient to have a good and intimate restaurant at the hotel - but we would choose to go for the a la Carte menu as opposed to the Surprise Menu, which didn't quite live up to our expectations. The location of L'Hotel couldn't be better, especially if you are in for visiting art galleries and doing some shopping in Saint Germain. Don't forget to let the guys in the reception give you advice on which restaurants to go for in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romulo P
Reviews.Content: Right from the start we wanted to stay at the left bank. Specifically at St Germain des Près. So we found this small boutique hotel with a One-Michelin star restaurant and the additional charm of being the place where Oscar Wilde died in 1900. Location Absolutely perfect. Right in the middle of St Germain, within walking distance from dozens of bistros, bars, restaurants and other amazing places, we were very pleased with this neighborhood. The area is very well served from the subway and it is easy to go from there to any other place in Paris. Also, it is so close to the Louvre that you can walk (and I definitely recommend this) from the hotel to the museum, and then head to Champs-Elysées to finally reach the Arc de Triomphe. It's really special! The street (Rue de Beux Arts) is packed with art gallerys (and you probably are going to see yourself standing in the street admiring some of the nice paintings) and is often taken by the fine arts students that go to the bars nearby to have a drink. For us, it was an amazing setting! Service (Concierge, Food, Cleaning, Internet) L'Hôtel has a good set of services: great breakfast (not usually included in the fare), rooms are pretty clean and neat and free internet. Here, I have one drawback: concierge services. We asked the man at the reception to see if we could get Opera tickets. We were a little disappointed because it took one day for him to get the information that we actually missed the Opera we wanted to see. Besides that, we were recommended a lousy restaurant at the only night we asked him for any recommendations. We expected a lot more on concierge services for a 4-star hotel. Apparently, they also have a special pool at the top level which we could not enjoy due to time restrictions. Rooms (Size, Decoration) Rooms are small. But do not expect large rooms in Paris. So, if you compare to other hotels in the city, L'Hôtel rooms have a good size. Beds are comfortable and big. We went during the fall so air conditioning was ok. I guess that in the summer it could get hot in the rooms (but it's really just guessing). Bathrooms are actually big and comfortable. Bath products are amazing and they sell it at the reception. There is one last thing about the rooms: decoration. The hotel is actually what was once a 1800s house. And one of its charms is exactly this. Point is, the decoration of the place is supposed to remember you of that time. It means that room ornaments have kind of a baroque style and can be too dark and heavy for some people. So, if you don't like this kind of decoration, maybe it is not the place for you. Finally, L'Hôtel was a really good experience and we would definitely recommend the place. Just make sure you like the style and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: alipeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything promised. A truly unique property, fantastic location and incredible service. The staff was so discreet it almost seemed as if this was our private home and they only appeared as needed. We stayed four nights, for an art buying trip, and Stefan, the manager, went above and beyond to help us with various issues we encountered along the way. We were in a junior suite and it was worth every penny. The bathroom was large, even by US standards, it had a lovely sitting room and a good sized bedroom with a very comfortable bed. The staff was always accommodating, they made/changed restaurant reservations as needed and were always available with recommendations. This was just a wonderful experience all around, we are already making plans to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on the Left Bank, however rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlFromMoscow
Reviews.Content: If you prefer to stay on the Paris’s Left Bank and you want something unusual and, let’s say, cosy, as compared to chain hotels, it’s exactly what you are looking for! I don’t feel a bit sorry that we’ve stayed at this hotel. Here you will discover how attentive decorators were to each detail (double curtains in the room, aged mirrors, old furniture, antique ceiling lamp, lovely decorated bathroom). Moreover, they provide you with big bottles (as compared to customary little and every day bottles of shower gel and etc.) of shower gel, shampoo and shower oil (which you can also purchase downstairs at the reception). The last one is exceptionally good and useful after long walks around Paris :) The only uncomfortable thing is the size of the room, which you, actually, don’t notice until the second or third day (so for those going on weekends it might be ok). And the noise (it’s not only in this hotel that you hear it, it seems to be a general problem, no matter where I’ve stayed in Paris). If you open a window during the night it might be a bit noisy (most often because of the cars). Price is adequate for Paris but a bit high for such small room (285 euros per night for ), but, as mentioned above, I don’t feel a bit sorry paying this amount for such great experience. Breakfast is good. Not such a big variety but the quality of the food is good. Young gentlemen at the reception were also very nice and always ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, and Parisienne in every way.”
Reviews.Author: roughrob
Reviews.Content: When compared to similarly priced hotels in other cities it would be easy to cite areas for improvement here, but that would be missing the point. This place is about instantly connecting you to the Latin Quarter and its history. It’s small, tucked away beyond the knowledge of most taxi drivers and wonderfully opulent. The rooms are all situated off of a beautiful spiral staircase and become more luxurious the higher up you go, so the best plan is to book as high up the building as your budget and their availability will allow, but worth noting that most of the views are of neighbouring buildings. The general hotel facilities are quite small, particularly the lift which will accommodate one large or two small people at best. The restaurant is great and well worth pre-booking. Failing that, everywhere that’s anywhere in the Latin Quarter is within walking distance. There is a charm and character about the place that it’s difficult to ignore, so I would definitely recommend a stay here, you’ll still be talking about it for some time after.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Leeptaylor
Reviews.Content: This was a special treat for my husband's 40th & this wonderful hotel made it very special indeed. The room was very small, but beautiful and spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly & helpful and the location was perfect: easy access to everything and in an attractive and quiet street. If you're planning a trip to Paris and you don't mind a room on the small side, then I would definitely recommend this beautiful and unusual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: thedude1NewYork
Reviews.Content: 2 minute walk to the louvre , 5 minutes to notre dame .. metro stop on the corner ... 2 minute walk to many great cafe's and nightlife ... couldnt find a better location...quiet street, but a few blocks away there are a ton of bars and cafes...the hotel is the hotel that author oscar wilde died in , and is actually a stop on "Rick Steve's left bank walking tour " ..the staff was very friendly and very helpful ... liked them a lot .. the hotel is beautiful ...very nicely decorated, very clean, very luxourious, with a comfotable bar, and reading room ... the restaurant was closed but it must be good because even our taxi driver knew about how good it was ... the room was small (in fairness we did book the smallest one they had) but it was very clean and very richly furnished/ decorated ... we had a great stay from the minute we arrived until the minute we left ..would stay there again for sure ..helpful tip ..if u are planning to go to the eiffel tower , buy your tickets in advance from the website.. this will literally save you hours

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marvellous, unsurpassable!!”
Reviews.Author: arderne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon many years ago and it was completely and utterly wonderful. Amzing,quirky, fabulous hotel with fabulous food, discreet, casual and lovely staff - just marvelllous And the private hammam is tremendous too.

Reviews.Title: “The most gorgeous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jules0703
Reviews.Content: Part of me wants to keep this hotel ssecret as its so beautiful. The other part wants to share the sheer beauty of the experience. I have stayed at the sister hotel in Amsterdam (before and after being owned by this group). So I knew it was going to be good! Everything is perfect. The location, so central. Quiet. Discreet. Beautifully decorated. Great bar, restaurant. The layout of the hotel is unique - rooms around a small central column. It has a hammam, pool and massage rooms. the pool is private so you book it for your own swim - and its in the style of a Roman bath. Its beautiful. Oscar Wilde died here. Frank SInatra stayed. Ava Gardner always insisted onthe same room each time she stayed. I can understand the loyalty! Staff mostly great. Antoine gave us a tour of the hotel so we could decide if we would stay. He was very helpful. His manager not so helpful. Our one niggle was that our trip was paid for by my in laws but they would not accept their card details. They also wanted payment on check in. I wonder whether they treat everyone like that? We felt a little like we were treated as would-be hustlers! But we put that to one side and enjoyed our stay. Anotine showed us a suite and a classic room. The classic room is perfect for a night or two. Teh suite better if you are staying longer IF you decide you want the space and aren't going to go out! August is cheaper than other times of the year so we got a good rate. Book direct with the hotel not through an agent as Mr andMrs Smith still advertising rooms at full rate. When they were discounted at over 120 plus euros! We had evening drinks at Cafe Flore and breakfast coffees at Cafe deux Magots both 2 minutes walk from the hotel. And the lovely chap on reception (Tuesday evening) recommended the best times to go to get the best of the experience of both - including which got the best sunshine and when so we could sit outside. He also recommded Cafe Lipp ( I love the Belle epoque brasseries). And we called into an old haunt - Cafe Julien (great puddings and decor); Indulge yourself. Stay here. Its a beautiful slice of Paris. NB to staff. Help with luggage on check out would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Plus/minus”
Reviews.Author: the-shmi
Reviews.Content: My review is mixed. I thought the hotel was pleasant enough, but my friend that I stayed with hated it and decided to book a hotel within a day of getting there. Her complaints: small room for the price (true, but I was okay with it), dim lighting (again true, but it didn't bother me), and she didn't like the antique-style bathtub. She thought the front desk was very rude, but we had just gotten there and were jetlagged so maybe we were a bit off. I didn't mind the room, but I agree that it could have been better for the price, but then again, that's Paris, i guess. The location was great. The bar was really cute and there was quite an interesting scene there in the evenings, with people there for drinks. It never got too crowded, though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - would return for sure”
Reviews.Author: KdJd2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days at the end of June and had a great time. The normal rooms are small but very nice and we had plenty of a/c, which was critical due to temperatures at the time. The location is excellent on a small street an easy walk to almost everything you might want. This is a very french hotel, small lobby, small room, but very nice with very competent service. There is a pool (Hamman) in the basement, we looked at it but never made use of it although it looked as though it could be fun if you had the time. Not a great place for families and kids I would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Paris' most romantic hotel?”
Reviews.Author: iphonenyc
Reviews.Content: L'Hotel is simply a pleasure. It is a small boutique hotel on the Left Bank, great reception, friendly staff and quaint rooms that speak as if from Paris in the '20s. Every room - I've stayed in three - looks as if art directed for the imminent arrival of Oscar Wilde or Jean Cocteau; both of whom were in residence at one time. Along with its old world charm comes strong wi fi on each floor. Special attention was paid to the baths. The small bar off the reception is charming, the breakfast a delight. The small elevator is fine to get you to your room but if you travel with many large cases you may feel limited. Otherwise, first rate in every sense.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, awful manager”
Reviews.Author: Europeancoupleabroad
Reviews.Content: This was a present to my husband for his birthday. He is Parisian and loves St Germain so I chose this hotel based on location, to me one of the best. The rooms however are tinny, at almost 400€ a night we could have been to the Ritz which offers much, much better value for your money. The staff are kind but the manger in the reception was rude, short in all his answers when questioned and unwilling to go out of his way to help. We asked for a later check out that he straight away refused. When caught in a traffic jam we called to let them know we would be half hour late and spoke to somebody else in reception who said it was no problem at all. I arrived to the reception (where other couple was checking out) and apologised again and he just muttered so rude sentence like "you should not as at the end you got what you wanted". I was shocked but when he left his colleague apologised and said he was not an easy person. I am sorry but at this price, and specially considering how small the premises are, I expect top service. To me this is a hotel that is on top league for prices but bottom league for value for your money and service provided. Sadly not a place I would ever recommend to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!! Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq305
Reviews.Content: Beautiful. Spotlessly clean. Everyone at this Hotel were so helpful. I started emailing the delightful men at the Front desk about 5 weeks before our trip. Between Alexandre, Guialme and Aheim, they secured every Restaurant reservation I was interested in. The trip was mine and my husband's 20th Wedding gift to one another, as well as our first trip to Paris. (We renewed our Vows at the American Cathedral) Carlos the Barman is sweet and charming and introduced us to new delcious cocktails. There is an underground pool, that you can book for one hour at time just for yourself. A must!!

Reviews.Title: “A Total One Off.”
Reviews.Author: SW4Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This magnificently unique hotel swallowed us whole for 4 nights. We forgot we had a family or even a life back home until we were rudely spat back out onto the Eurostar on sunday. Our room was the one that Oscar Wilde apparently holed up in towards his death and the deep red curtains, painted peacock wallpaper and sumptuous sleigh bed couldn't have offered him a more dramatic backdrop for his last act. For those of us more inclined to living the shower was truly epic and should have been equipped with a snorkel. The breakfast was perfectly Parisian (yet English in its portions) and the hotel was plonked bang in the middle of the most chic bit of Paris imaginable. Original glamour of this quality is priceless which is fortunate because it cost an arm and a leg, but as soon as they've grown back I'll be heading back for more. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Most romantic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hunkymunky001
Reviews.Content: We returned home feeling thoroughly spoiled and indulged. EVERY whim was catered for by the discrete but attentive staff. This boutique hotel is in the heart of St. Germain, just 100m walk from the Seine itself. The 6 storey atrium is breathtaking and the room was fin-de-siècle opulence. Highlights include the Hammam pool and steam room which you can book privately and the Michelin starred restaurant. Exceptional! Recommended for lovers and bon vivants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Gatorfan-Craig
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for our anniversary and were looking to stay at a boutique hotel. We could not have found a better hotel. First, the staff was friendly and amazingly helpful, a special thank you to Alex who provided us with great recommendations and even better reservations at a nearby cafe. Second, the restaurant at L'Hotel was fantastic and booking that is a must for anyone staying there. We booked a chic room, which was a bit pricey, but the larger bathroom and living space was worth it. Overall, L'Hotel is pricey, but worth it as you do get what you pay for and in Paris what isn't anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Nice french hotel in an extraordinary location...”
Reviews.Author: Smooth23
Reviews.Content: in St. Germain. 2 minutes walking distance to the Seine. This Hotel has the charme of a early century. The rooms are small but unique, equipped with high end Tech (Bang & Olufson). The Hotel might not be worth its price, but which Hotel in Paris is worth its price. Recommendations are welcome. The stuff was very nice as well. The only main drawback is that there are actually no parking spaces in the near neighbourhood. If you look for a unique hotel which is located very good in the french capitol this hotel might fit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girlfriend Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NomadicNina
Reviews.Content: Just returned from lovely 3 day respite( in midst of 8 day business trip in Southern France and London), where I was the lucky lady whose 3 great lady pals from NJ came to meet me for weekend of eating, shopping and exploring in Paris!!!! We chose this hotel for its beauty and charm, and great location--and it did not disappoint. Velvet-covered walls, fab bath product, magical staircase and lobby areas. The rooms we stayed in (40 and 44, actually suites) were lovely, beds comforwable, the purple velvet clad men at the front desk beyond helpful with dinner recommendations, taxi calls, etc, the dinner at the Michelin Star restaurant superb and sublime. Hammam grand fun! BUT the breakfast was disappointing, both in the dining room as well as room service--it was as if they did not help us enjoy this meal . No oatmeal, slim pickings, unfocused service, Also because its just a 20 room hotel, they do not have any service between midnight and 7am so no late night tea to calm an upset stomach, no coffee with 5;45 wake up call, no one to help with luggage for early morning departure. Also, lighting in rooms not adequate and room 44 smelled heavily of smoke entire stay. Loved the experience of this famous spot, but it was very pricey and has its limitations, so I must conclude that I would not stay here again, tho I would recommend it and am glad we tried it. Made for a perfect girls getaway. Next time, however, will go back to more service oriented places, it is what a group of 50 year old ladies want and need.

Reviews.Title: “Camp and charming, with warm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Aziraphale
Reviews.Content: We utterly loved our recent stay at L'Hotel. True, it is in the expensive side, but compared to other experiences in Paris it was totally worth it. We stayed in a Grand room which was as beautiful and OTT as the website room tour would suggest, as was all aspects of the hotel depicted on the website. We were apprehensive about ordering breakfast in our room having read previous negative comments, but we found nothing to complain about. The patisserie was fresh, and looked to have been from the local Paul, and the rest of the meal was wonderful. We didn't get a chance to use the hamman pool due to our schedule. I consoled myself with the idea that it probably would have been freezing anyway, only to discover it was a perfect temperature when visiting on the way out. The bar was intimate, with some of the best whiskey and cocktails I've had for a long time. Best of all, the service is wonderful - reason enough to come back. We took at look at one of the mignon suites before we left to see how this would compare for a less luxurious trip. Whilst on the small side, they were nowhere near as small as indicated in previous reviews, and more than comparable value with other Parisian establishments. The Left Bank location is also perfect, being virtually opposite the Louvre and a short walk from the Musee D'Orsay. If you want to treat yourself, don't bother with anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Cleo168
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great staff. Nicest people I met in Paris. Made me feel welcome and at home. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Snaize
Reviews.Content: We loved L'Hotel. The staff were all incredibly friendly, helpful, solicitous. The design here is gorgeous. The room we stayed in was TINY, but was advertised as such ("Bijoux", I believe). So well decorated though that we hardly cared. The bar is cozy and adorable. The restaurant was delicious. I was given a "ladies menu" (sans prices) which is pretty old school - at least in America this rarely happens. The 6th arr is full of wonderful galleries and cafes and a short walk to the Louvre if you are in town for some sightseeing. I thought the price ($450/night, approx, in high season) was very fair given the location and level of service here. We'd love to go back some day soon. Everything you want from a boutique hotel - -stylish, but not getting by on style alone.

Reviews.Title: “Super location but do not look at room rates”
Reviews.Author: esperto66
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite locations in Paris VI, weird building, small swimming pool in the basement.. book it on arrival. But extremely expensive given the old structure, poor care of details especially in old, to-be-renovated bathrooms, thick moquettes, etc.. you are in old Paris for a high price...but you may like it a lot

Reviews.Title: “This is such a romantic place!”
Reviews.Author: SeanVdB
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staf! We slept in the Oscar Wilde Room. Such a lovely room! Nice Hammam and little pool! Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Sexy and the best Hendrick Martinis in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Fashion3002
Reviews.Content: I love the quirky L'Hotel for its classic Paris plush in new Jacques Grange interiors, along with the fact that it used to be a brothel, has a two man bath in its cellar grotto, a Michellin-starred restaurant, a kiss cosy bar, and that Wilde had the foresight to drop dead there. Plus - one of the few bars in Paris that knows how to make a really good Hendricks Martini.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, fabulous, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jkr_on_the_web
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the 'Apartément' for three nights with my best friend, and she and I had the time(s) of our life given the ambience of the place and charming staff. After painstakingly looking for a downside aspect for a while, I have to say that the elevator really is a tad bit too small ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and over-priced.”
Reviews.Author: superbadgrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced for what you get. TINY rooms - especially knowing we were put in one of the smallest rooms, but had prepaid for one of the more grand / larger rooms. Of course they didn't have any other rooms to put us in and did NOT offer a refund of any kind. Some of the staff was rather rude to us - not sure if it was because we are Americans or why - but did notice they were rude to another American couple who was in the lobby. Tiny elevator that is slow - had power issues in the room - extremely difficult to get a cab there.... overall loved Paris - awful time at L Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: travellerEugene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hotel for 4 nights last week and were SO impressed. It exudes charm. The service, especially Georgine, was very helpful in arranging reservations and getting cabs, etc. I can't wait to come back to Paris to stay here again! Our room was big enough, and it was one of the regular rooms- it was gregariously decorated, and that was part of the fun. I love small boutique luxury hotels, and this ranks as one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, Overpriced, Dirty and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: ReggieF
Reviews.Content: I'm an experienced traveler who seeks out charming boutique hotels. I can deal with character over comfort. L'Hotel is a lot of hype and not a great choice if you want a charming boutique hotel in Paris. I stayed there after reading recommendations for L'Hotel in countless travel magazines and after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. I ignored the reviews of people complaining of dirty drapes and uncomfortable beds. I figured they were picky travelers not interested in the charm of boutique hotels. I was wrong. I left L'Hotel after one night. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. I know they say the beds aren't great in France but I've stayed in other Paris hotels and they are FAR better. There is no air conditioning - I traveled in July and this was unbearable. The drapes were torn, the wallpaper was peeling off the wall, the upholstery was dusty and dirty. This is far from charming - it's neglect. The furniture was uncomfortable, the bathrooms old. The rooms are around $700 US a night. For that price, I ended up moving to a Deluxe room at Le Bristol for the same price. I couldn't believe the difference! Great bed, air conditioning, and still charming! The only good things about L'Hotel are the staff and the location. The staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful. The location is great. For a left bank hotel I prefer Relais Christine. Great location, great staff, comfy, clean and many rooms come with your own garden patio - the breakfast room is a stone cellar...so French and charming! The rooms have a somewhat modern decor but the beds are comfortable, the rooms are quiet and romantic. If you really want to stay here - I do recommend renting an hour in the cellar pool for two. It was very romantic and I am happy we stayed for one night for this unique experience. In summary, L'Hotel is a neat hotel to VISIT and have a drink in the legendary bar. Just don't get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feldgend
Reviews.Content: Stayed at L'Hotel for three nights in a standard room (Room 330) in mid-January. The room was well-appointed and the size one would expect for a standard Paris hotel room. The bathtub was incredible and well-sized. The best part of our stay was reserving the steam room/hamman pool in the evening after walking the city and before dinner. It's a great way to relax on a colder winter day. The pool/steam room is in the cellar, very private, and included in the room price. The staff was superb - attentive and helpful. The hotel is located in the heart of the Left Bank in a historic building (Oscar Wilde died in the hotel when it was a boarding house). I plan on staying at L'Hotel again when I'm in Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdventureWalker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris in October, where we stayed for 4 nights. What really made our stay in Paris unforgettable was L´Hotel. Staying in the Oscar Wilde room was truly memorable, the room is decorated in a manly romantic style, very opulent and literary. The bathroom is wood paneled with everything you could ask for, walk in shower, bath, fantastic fittings etc. Bed is very comfortable with delicious bed linen. The michelin-star restaurant is not to be missed, in the bar we caught sight of Mick Jagger and on another night Eric Cantona. The service is friendly and there are a lot of personal touches. The decoration adds to the whole wonderful atmosphere of luxurious decadence, which is also totally modern. The piece de resistance is the private pool in the basement, which also has a steam room. This can be booked in advance for your private use, after a hard day of museum gazing to fall into the pool and steam off your sore feet is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “We can't stay anywhere else in Paris now..”
Reviews.Author: Hula_Hooper
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at L'Hotel (first was in 2008). The first time we stayed in the slightly larger Bijou room, but this category was booked out so we plumped for the smallest room category, Mignon, for our second stay last month. I had my reservations that the Mignon room may be too small, but it turned out to be perfectly large enough for our needs. Each room is decorated differently, and despite being smaller, we actually preferred the room we were assigned this time than the previous one. We also found the general maintenance of the hotel had improved a lot from our first visit (without losing its charm). The feel was therefore more luxurious and we loved it even more this time round. The great location of the hotel has been commented upon many times, so I shan't repeat it here. But it is worth specifically mentioning the good and friendly front desk service (often the factor which lets so many parisian "boutique" hotels down)! Just one comment I hope the hotel management will bear in mind though. We planned a special meal at the one Michelin-starred restaurant at the hotel and I had informed the hotel when booking that one of the guests is vegetarian. I was told the chef will accommodate this off-menu, which we appreciated. I know Paris isn't exactly a vegetarian-friendly city, but as it turned out, the veggie main course was really rather disappointing. As Arpege has shown, vegetarian dishes can be exciting, unusual and delicious (salt encased beet!) - perhaps the chef could include just one vegetarian main course on the menu to show he or she has considered the needs of his vegetarian guests? Finally, I noticed L'hotel is owned by the same British hotel group who owns the Cowley Manor in the UK, as the toiletries (fab) and even the butter which came with our breakfast had Cowley Manor branding on it. I hope British imported products won't start over-running the hotel as the distinctive parisian left-bank feel of L'hotel is surely the key to its success. Anyway, we love this property and will find it difficult to stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisintheFall09
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we could not have picked a better hotel. The staff was extraordinarily helpful, the rooms were gorgeous and the bar was perfect. Carlos the bartender is not to be missed. The location is perfect for being within walking distance of everything you will want to see. If you are only going to Paris once in your life you should definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand luxe parisien”
Reviews.Author: voyageurMTLAH
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous small hotel superbly located 100m from Place St-Germain on a historic street. Stunning architecture and layout (open central skylight). Our room (the low-end) was quite spacious and comfortable, and decorated in incomparably decadent, Belle Époque opulence, but certainly hip. The staff were faultless and had just the right discrete Continental formality (although they gave me the wrong address for a very well known restaurant). Gorgeous bar and restaurant, plush and stylish. The only problem with the hotel is it was booked through my stay except one night, dommage!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever...”
Reviews.Author: April1972
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We were first put into a room that was so unattractive we refused to stay in it and were moved into their art deco room which was cold, weird and uncomfortable. Light bulbs were missing, phone lying around on the floor, bed was damp when we went to bed... If you spend €680 a night you expect a luxurious great room and it was very disappointing. We considered leaving but didn't want to disrupt our trip any more. We complained and asked to see the manager who in 3 days failed to come back to us. Third night we moved to another room which was more charming but so noisy and we were kept awake between 4 and 5 am when they bring out their laundry... shouting, slamming doors. Not to bore everyone to tears, maybe we were unlucky but it is the worst hotel experience we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maberta
Reviews.Content: No room service for a guest that arrive at 23:30, nothing hot and nothing cold to eat.... no hot water in our bathroom we reserve a table at restaurant and we didn't find it for our dinner!!! And the staff tell me to go out and find myself a restaurant... this is incredible!!!! We try to order something in our room and the tell me that the chef can't do anything for room service and we can order only a omlette or a club sandwich... They didn't clean my bed!!!!!! The room are very very small, the double is like a single room! §The staff tell me that they can't do nothing for me... But the table at the restaurant, the hot water, the bed clean are not a request are the standard for a guest and this hotel don't have it. For me this is a fake 4 star hotel because the elevator is for 2 persons and slow solw slow.... no portrage, no rooms clean, no hot water in bathroom, no good staff.... I don't know what they have to be a 4 star. Never go! Never Never Go! My bad experience in Paris... After this they give my the check of my room without a smile but with a bad face... Incredible!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Handly location, Parissian style”
Reviews.Author: SouthCoasterNSW
Reviews.Content: Due to a mistake by our travel agent, we arrived a day earlier than booked, with no room available. After initial panic, we decided to leave our bags and explore the neighbourhood, and perhaps to find another hotel nearby. The street the hotel is located in is one small block from the river and very quiet but literally moments away from the action. It is within easy walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame, but more importantly, the wonderful neighbourhood of St-Germain-des-Pres. It is full of high quality retail establishments, cafe's, restaurants and bars. A highlight for me was the unique and high quality gourmet stores such as bakery Poilâne, Pierre Herme, artisan oil store Jean Leblanc Huilerie Artisanale, a Laduree store, two of the cities best chocolatiers, and a wonderful fromagerie I can’t recall the name of! And of course there are the wonderful galleries. If the area is not enough for you, then there is the hotel. By the time we got back there, they offered us a suite (we had booked a room at around 300 euro) for 420 euro including breakfast. As it was a 700+ room, it was a great deal so we took it. I am so glad we did. Our chinoiserie style room was beautiful, and had I not spent a night in this spacious suite (it was more like a large room), I would not have enjoyed the hotel as much. The standard rooms are tiny..... Full of character but tiny. If you have the budget, definetaly go for the suites. The character of this historic hotel outweighs the lack of space in rooms and the pool is cool! Its unique and boutique – like I like them!

Reviews.Title: “Something special a hotel that makes Paris even more romantic !”
Reviews.Author: Rorydevon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is straight from a movie set. The decor is over the top - think Oscar Wilde meets Lacroix. From the glamorous receptionist to the amazing 6 storey circular hallway leading to the chic bedrooms. This hotel has style but with a good sense of fun. Our room, for 280 euros a night was small but fabulous. Some one was very bold in their styling ! It could have been an over the top disaster but it all works. Full marks for not another " Schrager syle boutique hotel" We only had the 18 euro breakfast once as there are plentiful atmospheric Parisienne cafes around doing great coffee and croissants - what more could you need.....

Reviews.Title: “Understated and tres chic!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMV
Reviews.Content: Great location (quiet street but only moments from hustle and bustle), close to the Louvre, Saint Sulpice etc. Very well decorated and some special touches. Being able to book the steam and plunge pool for ourselves was great and surely unique in central Paris?? Cosy bar and possibly the smallest lift we have ever seen (but it all adds to the experience!).

Reviews.Title: “Best hidden gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingFamily
Reviews.Content: Our stay in L'hotel was unforgettable, due to the character, the location and above all the atmosphere of the hotel and it's neighbourhood. Especially in Springtime, Paris can be magic to those who are in this romantic city, enjoying a special time with each other. L'hotel has a small pool, unfortunately the water was too cold! Breakfast is not included, but worth a try. Our room on the 4th floor was excellent : huge, clean and perfect beds. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We'd love to go here again, enjoying a lovely time in the most romantic city of the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Queen Margot's lovenest”
Reviews.Author: IcanPackin2min
Reviews.Content: I'm originally from Paris, and spending money on a hotel in my hometown was counterintuitive. Still, that one night my boyfriend and I spent at l'Hotel made it worth the money. The setting was magical. From the moment you stepped into the cozy lobby, you could feel the establishment's comfortable warmth radiating through its unique architecture and the decor's intricate details. The opulence of our Bijoux room made up for its modest size. The interior design was plush and sophisticated, unlike anything else I'd ever seen. It literally took us back in time. The private pool and hammam can be reserved by the hour and are the ideal treat to complement a long day of shopping in the lovely St. Germain des Pres neighborhood. The service was excellent, the staff dedicated and respectful of privacy. Overall, I highly recommend l'Hotel, it perfectly embodies the lushness of a romantic Parisian escapade.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with Oscar Wilde”
Reviews.Author: vonOtter
Reviews.Content: “My wallpaper and I are fighting a duel to the death. One or other of us has got to go.” — Oscar Wilde (1854-1900), at Hôtel d’Alsace, a pension house, now simply L’Hôtel The wallpaper did not go; Oscar Wilde did. We spent five nights in the very room where Wilde spent his last years, following his release from a two-year term of imprisonment at Reading Gaol. And then Wilde passed into eternity from this very room. The wall covering of Room No. 16 is based on illustrations and descriptions of Wilde’s dining room in London. Peacocks strut and preen on tooled and heavily impasto green leather of the upper half of the walls. Some of these showy birds appear to kiss; because these are peacocks only, the nod to “the love that dare not speak its name” is well understood. Heavy wood furniture, marble-topped tables (one with a large flat-screen TV on it), brass lamps combine to give the feel of an English gentleman’s club. Any hotel accommodation is put to the test by how well you sleep. The comfortable mattress passes this test with flying colors. The small, planted terrace is an excellent spot to enjoyed breakfast, courtesy of L’Hôtel’s room service, each morning. At 18 euros per serving, it is possible to split the ample breakfast of croissants, baguettes, jams, cereal, coffee, orange juice, milk, and yogurt and still be satisfied. Room #16 faces north; it does not get too warm, even during a warm Parisian summer, and the air conditioning worked just fine. For a warm-weather stay, I would suggest reserving one of the north-facing, rear rooms (numbers 14, 16, 24, 26, 34, 36, 44, 46) to avoid the heat of the sun and the heat reflected from the buildings across the street. With only 20-accommodations, L’Hôtel is a boutique hotel. It is a pricey treat; but it is worth it. Mick Jagger, Johnny Depp, and Keanu Reeves have been among the celebrities who have thought so as well. L’Hotel rightfully trades on its historical association with Oscar Wilde. Photographs of the late 19th century wit and playwright and letters written by him to friends hang framed in the lobby; his likeness decorates the heavy brass key fob, as well as a plaque outside the front door. In the late 19th century the establishment was called Hôtel l’Alsace, where the author of “The Importance of Being Ernest” left an unpaid bill exceeding 26,000 francs. Letters to Wilde asking him to settle his tab are framed and displayed over the writing desk in Room #16. The public areas are sumptuously decorated in a style that brings the Second Empire to mind. With plush green and red velvets, trims of gold tassels, pedestal tables with black marble tops, brass wall sconces, cameo medallions, striped wallpaper edged with classical scene borders one might expect Empress Eugènie to walk through the door. A publicly available 21st century computer tucked in a corner of the lobby does not even intrude on the illusion of time. Designer Jacques Garcia is the man responsible for this over-the-top fantasy décor. After a refreshing, hour’s dip in the basement pool (quite a rarity in these small, Left Bank buildings) and a stop in the steam room you can slip into the plush bathrobe and slippers that come with each room. You will need to reserve the use of this spa at the front desk; massages, by reservation too, are also available. The complementary bath gel, bath oil, shampoo and conditioner are quite nice. The staff, all young, attractive and friendly, is very attentive. I had reserved the room directly with the hotel because I wanted to be certain that we booked “la chambre Oscar Wilde,” therefore I was in touch with the hotel regularly. My e-mails were always answered promptly, including my request that L’Hôtel reserve us a table for diner at Le Jules Verne, the restaurant in the Eiffel Tower. L’Hôtel does have its own restaurant, rated one star by Michelin. We would have eaten there but it had closed for the very sane traditional French summer month-long break on the very day we arrived. L’Hôtel is ideally situated in the middle of the 6th arrondissement on Rue des Beaux-Arts, and much of Paris stands within easy walking distance. The River Seine, only few blocks away, gives you easy access to the Musée du Louvre by a quick walk across Pont des Artists. To the south, at the corner of Boulevard St-Germain and Rue Bonaparte are Café des Deux Magots and Café de Fleurs. Across the street from Café des Deux Magots stands St-Germain des Pres, as well as the St-Germain Metro stop of the yellow #4 line, giving quick connections to the entire Metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Arnaudlyon
Reviews.Content: My pregnant fiancée and myself celebrated our first year in l'Hôtel. Bad points: - old : a few things not really in good shape (like drawer in the bathroom or frame in the lift) - swimming pool too cold - welcome at the desk in the afternoon was above average and information not really exhaustive (did not know too much events going on those days) - shower curtains would diserve to be looked after (stains) Good points (a lot): - old (yes, bad but good point as well) : gives all the charm of this old Paris that is loved all over the world) - beautiful decoration of the hotel (particularly loved the tower staircase) and of the junior suite we were in - smiling staff at restaurant, accommodation, reception (day and night), room service which really enlights your stay - Steaming room : great stuff !!! - A lot of pressure in the showers with hot water as you wish; It was warm for us, coming from Ireland, and it these numerous showers were extremely relaxing!!! But let's not forget the huge bath for two... ;-) ....large enough and of course as much as hot water we want. - The roses bouquet and the note I had asked to organized for my lady was absolutely gorgeous: thanks!!! - Excellent diner at the 1 Michelin Star in house (yet too developped for my lady with the little flowers in the starter; a matter of taste as I personally loved it) - Had a touching surprise on our plates at the dessert (they were informed of our anniversary and drew around the plat a lovely "Félicitations" (Congratulations). Good job!!! - Funny Night Concierge (big white smile) and great Spanish Morning Receptionist We don't know any of the staff members names to be honest, sorry, but we would like to thank everybody for this wonderful and relaxing stay. Arnaud & Ewelina Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Problems from the start”
Reviews.Author: CarolineLondon1
Reviews.Content: I booked directly through the hotel website. Received confirming email,but then told that hotel was fully booked and they had no record of my booking.I sent them my confimation from hotel email.Night concierge tried to argue that "non,madame,you booked for the 13th not the 18th" when it was clearly the 18th! Day concierge managed to fit me into a junior suite on top floor. (not cheap!) Beautiful room. First night I was in a rush,no hot water in shower. They sent helpful plumber who fixed it on 30 minutes but I was getting desperately late for my party so thought bath might be better. About to fill up bath, thought I saw a few pubes. Glasses on and realised that at least 10 in bath! Eugh! Breakfast in dining room was at the mercy of very uppity waiters who were hovering around ignoring me and fixing lunch tables,even though I was within the cutoff time.Bored sighs when I asked for eggs.Cold coffee arrived,waiter poured it and missed,went in saucer,which he just left and sauntered off. I would recommend hotel only for the location. It is pretty, but very very run down.Huge bill ,especially if you consider the disgraceful state of bath and the general haughty treatment by dining room staff.

Reviews.Title: “Should be the best .... but it is not !”
Reviews.Author: totalhoteladdict
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quaint, personal hotel in ideal location. This should be hands down one of the top hotels in the city. But it is not. Here are few reasons why we thought our stay was mediocre: - run down. management has clearly cut back on maintenance. for example wood panneling around the bathtub was wrotten to the point that there was no paint left, just the wrotten wood. - light in the walk-in closet (good size) was a bare lightbulb hanging from the ceiling - safe had loose nuts and bolts inside. - a/c did not work well. room never really managed to cool down so had to sleep with the window open - our room had a bathtub but no shower ! unaceptable in this day and age. - nowhere to leave your towel hanging in the bathroom. I searched for a hook everywhere and finally opted for the floor. - shouldn't a hotel like this have proper hangers? they think otherwise and have the anti-theft version more adecuate for a 3 star and very unpractical. - the beautiful staircase smells of chlorine from the pool in the basement. takes away the charm of the place Few good things : - location - well priced and plentiful continental breakfast albeit a selection of only two cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but........”
Reviews.Author: keithgggg
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner checked in on Sunday at around 12pm but our room wasnt ready. We were advised to have a drink at the bar while we waited and were charged for it. The room itself was fine and had a nice balcony (5th floor) overlooking the small patio beneath. The hotel itself is compact but has 6 stories excluding the ground floor. The breakfast area, restaurant and bar are all the one but the seating is very comfortable. Beware though in Paris most gourmet restaurants are closed on Sundays and Mondays but we didnt expect the restaurant in the hotel to have this policy also. The only food available was roomservice. The staff were very friendly and were more then ready to accomodate our dining requirements - we decided on a restaurant on the top floor of the Monparnasse tower - cant remember the name. The temperature in Paris at this time was hot and we expected the airconditioning in our room to be working, I asked the receptionist the reason it wasnt and she told me that the hotel has a policy not to have airconditioning turned on until May 13th. All in all a nice hotel, not cheap even for Paris but it is not a five star hotel - 4 star max.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, properly”
Reviews.Author: DarrellWilson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have pretty high expectations for hotels in this price range. Beautiful/ cool decor, reliable staff, and a perfect location made our stay a value for the money. The interior is elegantly stuffed with luxury, comfort and quiet in equal measure. Our room was on the less expensive side of the ledger, but nonetheless was a decent size, particularly for Paris ...and smack in the middle of St Germain! The food was great; contemporary and creative, without being too fussy. We had a few special requests for the staff (no jumping through hoops, mind you) Champagne at 4pm, and some help with shopping bags -- They were diligent. I suppose i just can't stop thinking that it was a comfortable place; a good soft bed with beatiful decor. Best Paris for us yet.

Reviews.Title: “A total delight”
Reviews.Author: Madaboutem
Reviews.Content: L'Hotel is a real gem. Done up with real artistry, and yet with a lightness of touch geared to complete comfort, it was luxurious without being over the top or self-conscious, incredibly convenient for all the things we wanted to do, and really restful. On the one occasion we dined in (the last night), I really regretted we hadn't done it earlier. The chef needs a medal. I don't think I've stayed in a nicer hotel in the whole of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PC56
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel for 6 nights in a junior suite. Lasted one night only and cancelled the rest of our stay at this hotel and moved elsewhere. When we told the hotel staff that we wanted to check out early they were not interested as to why or what we thought was wrong. The hotel is very run down and dirty, the bathroom was so dirty and grotty that you felt cleaner before you had a shower and the service is almost non existent if you can find a staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, hidden gem but needing TLC”
Reviews.Author: Livingoutofasuitcase
Reviews.Content: Invited to dinner in Paris at Le Grand Trianon, Versailles. Spent only 1 night at this tiny, hidden gem. Interesting, quirky building. Best room is the top floor with views over Paris rooftops. Decor leaves you feeling like you are part of the Moulin Rouge film - lots of dark red, gold, heavy curtains and again ...quirky. This is an ideal location for antique & art hunting and just 3 mins from the Seine and a bridge across to the other side of the city. Breakfast was really good. This is a great romantic weekend away hide-away - not a massive, impossing 4-5 star grand hotel. Rooms, and we booked the best they had at over E600 a night, need some work. Primarily the windows and walls need repainiting as does the walk-in closet. It would take no more than an hour or two and E50 to fix these minor refurb issues ...just dont understand why they dont!? Perhaps its perceived as part of the charm?

Reviews.Title: “L'hotel nightmare”
Reviews.Author: kktripad1234
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for three nights at this hotel. On the third day (our wedding anniversary), we returned to find our bags in the lobby, having been packed by staff. A nasty clerk told us they had never received our email confirmation. I then presented our printed confirmation for three nights. The clerk rolled her eyeballs and said there was nothing she could do as the room was already occupied. She was completely unapologetic and dismissive. After sitting for two hours while she made a feeble attempt to find another hotel, I started looking myself on the net and made my own reservations (a very difficult task as it was Rugby and Fashion Week). It was our last night, so this was truly a disappointing way to leave Paris. In the end, after much arguing and unpleasantness, the manager gave us one night's stay free. Not worth the hassle. Have a drink at l'Hotel (because it truly is an interesting spot) and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: funkymonkey25
Reviews.Content: This is just the most fabulous hotel; laid-back and yet stylish; hip and yet not pretentious. A fantastic location too. And sensational food ! Having stayed in plenty of the so-called cool hotels in Paris (we come 5-6 times a year), this is where we'll stay from now on. Merveilleux !

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a Special Occasion”
Reviews.Author: NJF67
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by searching the web. Having read the other reviews I did have concerns about what we had booked but was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is fabulous, really different. We booked a deluxe room (now called a chic room!) which are expensive but then everything seems to be in Paris. It was spacious with views over the courtyard. It had plenty of storage space and a lovely large comfortable bed. Not all deluxe rooms have large beds we had to request this one. It's position is really good. In Saint Germain, 5 mins walk from the underground and about 5 mins to The Louvre just over the Seine. The hotel staff were really helpful, booked restaurants and taxis for us. We went for my birthday and this hotel did make it special. I would highly recommend it just don't think about how much you are spending.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: SMTORD
Reviews.Content: We booked a package here through Luxury Link, and stayed for three nights last week. When we confirmed the dates last fall,, we had requested a room with a balcony, and were confirmed in the "Queen Hortense" room. When we reconfirmed two weeks ago (a good idea), we were told we were in a different room, sans balcony. I e-mailed back to them the earlier confirmation, and we were upgraded to the apartment on the top floor. I won't repeat earlier reviews of this room; suffice it to say that it is indeed lovely, as is the rest of the hotel. While the bedroom was small, the king bed was wonderful and the linens divine. The "living room" was spacious, well-furnished, and full of light. The bathroom was charming, with a separate shower and high-end amenities. The breakfast was just coffee, juice, and croissants, but a dinner we had at the hotel was great, among the best we've had in Paris. The hotel staff are uniformly responsive, gracious and helpful, and the location is perfect. As much as we loved our stay at L'Hotel, I recognize that the experience was enhanced by the room we were given. With the going rate for the apartment at close to $1000/nt USD, I doubt that we would have selected it. We didn't see any of the other rooms, but given the size of each floor, I imagine that most are quite small as other reviewers have noted.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: bueller
Reviews.Content: After reading the pro and con reviews of this hotel, I was a little wary. We stayed one week, left for another destination for a week, and returned to L'Hotel for another two nights before going home. We had a standard room at 280 euros a night. The room was a decent size compared to other places we'd stayed in Paris, and the bathroom was very well designed and relatively large. They kept some of our luggage while we were gone for a week at no extra charge. The staff was helpful and friendly and the hotel has lots of history. Great location! The only thing I would note is that there is only one tiny elevator, and the spiral staircase may be a bit much for some. We had a room facing the courtyard which was very quiet, and the beds were very comfortable, making for a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the romantic Art Deco room at L'Hotel”
Reviews.Author: duffymoon
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night earlier in the week and it was FANTASTIC. The location is great and the hotel is unique in decor. we stayed in the Art Deco room which had the most amazing silver art deco bed that was in the centre of the room. The bathroom was huge and the bath was the best I have ever been in - the complimentary bath products were divine. We will definitely return and will make sure we make time for the romantic celler swimming pool. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “no place for clothes”
Reviews.Author: louhoover
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are gorgeous, but there is not even a shelf on which to put clothes or luggage. The room was small but made unlivable because of the clutter of day to day living from the suitcase that had to remain on the bed or in the floor. I expected small and expensive, but at least usable.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check into hotel, were shown to our room The Mistinguet Room only to find the air conditioning not working and the room had a distinct odour of stale cigarettes. We were offered a 15oEuro reduction and a fan. As the temperature was 80 plus and there seemed no immediate possibility that the air con would be fixed we asked to move hotels. They found us a place at a sister hotel Relais Christine, equally expensive but very nice and the air con worked. This visit was to celebrate an anniversary so although they were very charming and helpful it was not really a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Pitts.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very small room and very small bathroom, air conditioning didn't work, asked to change room and they said the rate would go from 280 euros per night to 600 euros per night, stayed one night and moved on down the street. I have been to Paris and other places in Europe, so, I was not expecting a big room, but, this was, in a word, is "the pitts". Would not recommend this hotel. Walt Brown Palm Spings, CA

Reviews.Title: “Very good in Saint Germain ”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: Very good and comfortable, surrounded by art galleries in a quiet ara. Staff spoke very good English. Public rooms are pleasant and my room was small but comfortable with a goode bed and furniture. Paid internet rate of EUR 280 plus continental breakfast EUR 22, which is on the high side.

Reviews.Title: “A glorified three-stars, vastly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: L'Hotel was extremely disappointing to me. The room we stayed in was 370 euros a night (breakfast not included), and at this price, l'Hotel doesn't deliver at all. The rooms are smallish and very stuffy. The carpet all over the place seems to have seen better days, and the fake plastic marble on the walls is downright horrible. The only nice touch is the central shaft, except that in the evening, cigar smoke goes up and into the rooms... I could live with that though, even if at this price, I was expecting a MUCH nicer and elegant hotel. What put me off the most was the service, quite rubbish. There's no mini bar in the room and I was told at 11 PM I would have to come down if I wanted a bottle of water. The restaurant closes at 10 PM and the barman scoffed at me when I asked if we could have dinner at 10.05. On the next day, we had a 22 euro per person breakfast, and got charged 6 more euros because one of us had musli in a small plastic bag!!!!!!! I'm French and that made me understand why French people have such a reputation for being rude, arrogant and unhelpful. But don't judge Paris by this place, you can get great service elsewhere, and bang for your buck in other hotels. The ONLY thing I liked about this hotel was the great and very practical location. Is it worth it? Definitely not. If you're used to good hotels, 4 stars and above, stay away from l'Hotel. If you don't have anything to compare it to, it might float your boat.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: montanamom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at L'Hotel for four days this past week. I stayed in one of the delux/jr. suite rooms on the 5th floor. (54) The room was very pretty and large. We also had a small balcony with a table and chairs. The bathroom was a total disappointment. The shower was very small and every time I used it water would go all over the bathroom. The shower curtain was really musty smelling and I could only get luke warm water. I thought this was a nice hotel I just feel that 640euro was alot to pay for this room. I expect alot more for that price. The hotel is in a good location, close to rue de buci where there are a lot of great restaurants. I have stayed at other hotels in Paris for the same price that I have enjoyed alot more.

Reviews.Title: “Haven in St-Germain”
Reviews.Author: mrsgreeny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the third time at L'Hotel on April 8. It is an absolute haven of calm and comfort in the city. Great location - 2 minutes walk from the heart of St-Germain and the Seine. Helpful and friendly staff (good English speakers). Wonderful rooms - quite small but beautifully decorated in a dark, velvety, opulent style, very comfortable bed, satellite tv with BBC1 and BBC2 as well as the usual stations, hi-fi system, Hermes toiletries in the bathroom, totally quiet at night. Fabulous for a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hotel is absolute heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the most blissful time at L'Hotel. It's absolute heaven. Stayed in the Queen Hortense room which was so elegant, peaceful, grand and romantic. I loved everything about it: the amazing silk wall hangings, the adorable terrace, the plush and exquisitely comfortable bed, the decadent, deep and perfect bath. The dining room is exquisite (only had time for breakfast, which was perfectly parisian), the atmosphere so cool, I can't wait to go back! Had some friends staying at the Ritz who were dying to leave their vulgar hotel and come hang out at my dreamy dreamy one. Plus the location! I would never ever want to stay anywhere else in Paris.
